name: exophoric
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
referring to something or understood because of something outside a text or conversation: exophoric reference The use of exophoric reference requires some shared knowledge between two speakers, or between writer and reader(s). Pronouns are often exophoric, as are words such as "this", "that", "here", "there". Compare
anaphoric
cataphoric
More examplesFewer examplesThis kind of exophoric reference does not depend on the specific situation to distinguish it. Exophoric often denotes a pronoun such as "I" or "you", whose meaning is determined by reference outside the discourse.In "Is that the one you were talking about?" the words "that" and "you" are exophoric, as they depend on contexts outside the conversation in order to be understood.
